title: Star Wars The Rise of Skywalker reveals run time and it breaks franchise record

Get ready to spend quite some time in a galaxy far far away.

After all the excitement around the release of the final trailer for the next Star Wars film and tickets going on sale, we now know how long the final instalment of the sequel trilogy will run for.

It has now been confirmed (via AMC Cinemas and Cineworld) that Star Wars: The Rise of Skywalker will run to 155 minutes - that's 2 hours 35 minutes.

This is the longest film in the franchise yet, beating the preceding instalment The Last Jedi by three minutes.

The ninth episode in the Skywalker saga will see Rey (Daisy Ridley ) and the Resistance face one final battle with the villainous First Order and their conflicted master, Supreme Leader Kylo Ren (Adam Driver).

But where will original trilogy Emperor Palpatine ( Ian McDiarmid ) enter proceedings?

We wait in anticipation for answers, but now we do know the run time, we can see how the film stacks up against the rest of the franchise.

(Image: Disney /Star Wars)

In terms of run time, here's how all of the films stack up, from longest to shortest.

1. The Rise of Skywalker - 155 minutes

2. The Last Jedi - 152 minutes

3. Attack of the Clones - 142 minutes

4. Revenge of the Sith - 140 minutes

5. The Force Awakens - 138 minutes

6. The Phantom Menace - 136 minutes

7. Solo: A Star Wars Story - 135 minutes

8. Rogue One: A Star Wars Story - 133 minutes

9. Return of the Jedi - 131 minutes

10. The Empire Strikes Back - 124 minutes

11. Star Wars (A New Hope) - 121 minutes

It is notable that the original trilogy films are the shortest entries in the entire franchise.

We are sure director J.J. Abrams has a good reason for the long run time, including an emotional goodbye to everyone's favourite protocol droid, C-3PO.

Star Wars: The Rise of Skywalker is released in UK cinemas on December 19, 2019.
